title: 107_hr568
content: The "Equity in Fertility Coverage Act of 2001" is introduced to ensure fairness in prescription drug coverage for fertility treatments under group health plans. This Act aims to amend the Public Health Service Act to address equity in fertility coverage. The "Equity in Fertility Coverage Act of 2001" requires group health plans covering impotency medications like Viagra to also cover fertility treatments. Plans can limit drug coverage and impose cost-sharing as long as it aligns with the Act. Plans must comply with notice requirements. The Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to include new requirements for plans. Section 2723(c) is also amended to include additional sections. Amendments to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 are made to add a new section. "Equity in fertility coverage is addressed in SEC. 714." Group health plans and health insurance issuers that cover impotency medications like Viagra must also cover fertility treatments. Plans can restrict covered drugs or impose limits on benefits and cost-sharing as long as they comply with the coverage requirement. This section is considered a material modification to the plan's terms. The text describes modifications to the plan's terms regarding coverage of impotency medications and fertility treatments. Amendments are made to various sections of the Act to ensure compliance with coverage requirements. The text introduces a new section on equity in fertility coverage in individual health insurance plans. Amendments are made to ensure compliance with coverage requirements for impotency medications and fertility treatments. The provisions of section 2707 apply to health insurance coverage in the individual market. Health insurance issuers must comply with notice requirements under ERISA. Amendments are made to section 2762(b)(2) and FEHBP section 8902. The amendments made by subsections (a), (b), and (c) of the Public Health Service Act apply to group health plans, health insurance coverage in the individual market, and contracts starting on or after January 1, 2002. Coordination of regulations is also addressed in the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996. The amendments made by this subtitle and section 401 refer to the provisions of part 7 of subtitle B of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 and parts A and C of title XXVII of the Public Health Service Act.
